alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 08 at 10:20PM EDT until May 09 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Conodoguinet Creek Near Hogestown affecting Cumberland County. For the Conodoguinet Creek...including Hogestown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Conodoguinet Creek Near Hogestown. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Low lying areas in the vicinity of Erbs Bridge Road, Prowell Road, Stone Spring Lane, and Oyster Mill Road are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM EDT Sunday was 8.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 3.5 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning.
